contentheadline.headline: Do not go gentle into that good night

contentrichtext.text: "'''Do not go gentle into that good night"''', a [[villanelle]], is considered to be among the finest works by Welsh poet [[Dylan Thomas]] (1914â€“1953). Originally published in the journal ''[[Botteghe Oscure]]'' in 1951,<ref>{{cite book |last=Ferris |first=Paul |coauthors= |title=Dylan Thomas, A Biography |year=1989 |publisher=Paragon House |location=New York |page=283 |isbn=1-55778-215-6}}</ref> it also appeared as part of the collection "In Country Sleep." Written for his dying father, it is one of Thomas's most popular and accessible poems.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/wales/arts/sites/dylan-thomas/pages/do-not-go-gentle.shtml |title=Dylan Thomas: Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night |date=6 November 2008 | accessdate=18 December 2010| work= | publisher=BBC WalesArts}}</ref> The poem has no title other than its first line, "Do not go gentle into that good night", a line which appears as a refrain throughout the poem. The poem's other equally famous refrain is "Rage, rage against the dying of the light". == References == {{reflist}} == External links == *[http://www.dylanthomas.com/ The Life and Work of Dylan Thomas] *[http://screenandsound.llgc.org.uk/ National Screen and Sound Archive of Wales] *[http://www.bbc.co.uk/wales/arts/sites/dylan_thomas/pages/do_not_go_gentle.shtml A short analysis by the BBC] *[http://www.poets.org/viewmedia.php/prmMID/15377 Read the poem and listen to it read by Dylan Thomas at poets.org] {{Dylan Thomas}} [[Category:Anglo-Welsh literature]] [[Category:1951 poems]] [[Category:Poetry by Dylan Thomas]] [[Category:Works originally published in Italian magazines]] [[Category:Works originally published in literary magazines]]
